title: Who framed Roger Rabbit?, It's Roger's Rabbit!
subject_group: Literature/Comic strip characters in motion pictures
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Comic strip characters in motion pictures
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Academy awards (Motion pictures)
abstract: Who framed Roger Rabbit? (99 mins. 1988)--Its Roger Rabbit! (28 mins)
description: Who framed Roger Rabbit? is a magical blend of live-acting and animation that comes off brilliantly due to the super effort by Bob Hoskins in playing to imaginary "co-stars" who were drawn in later. Hoskins plays Eddie Valiant, a has-been gumshoe in the 1940's film noir mould who comes out of a self enforced "retirement". Someone is out to steal Toon Town from the cartoon characters who inhabit the magical land. To get their hands on the valuable property they frame its biggest star, Roger Rabbit for murder. Detective Valiant must solve the case and save the toons. Co-starring Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy, Stubby Kaye and Charles Fleisher. Based on the story "Who censored Roger Rabbit?" by Gary K Wolf. "It's Roger Rabbit!" is a compilation of three animated shorts - "Tummy Trouble", "Roller Coaster Rabbit" and "Trail Mix-Up" featuring Roger Rabbit and Baby Herman.
